description:
Overview

We are seeking a Data Analyst with a professional/strong understanding of enterprise-level data analysis, machine-learning, operations research, modeling, and business/mission intelligence tools.

Candidates must already possess a current and active TS/SCI with Poly clearance to be considered for this position

Responsibilities

The right candidate will have experience developing, implementing, integrating, and evaluating IC data architecture-related projects. A Professional/strong understanding of preprocessing of structured and unstructured data.

As well as:
• Experience providing senior level executive support in furtherance of the development of enterprise-wide data strategy initiatives.
• Experience supporting senior level executives providing direction, goals, objectives, and priorities for realizing the vision of Data as an IC Asset.
• Experience with coordinating the development of new data management and applications capabilities; providing technical expertise in data architecture; document and design specifications for data/software engineers; producing prototypes to demonstrate enterprise scalability and implementation of design; providing broad technical guidance.
• Possess extensive technical leadership abilities and an understanding of associated resource planning schedules, related regulations, policies, directives and standards, and program management practices and enterprise information technology (EIT) planning activities.
• Experience supporting efforts to develop a common set of design principles that supports the IT data strategy with an eye towards simplifying operations and maintenance while pushing for state- of-the-art capabilities.
• Experience with complex computer engineering projects or programs, resolve requirements shortfalls, parallel tasks, multiple dependencies, high risks, and multiple interfaces; manage the design, construction, testing, and implementation of technical and functional specifications; provide technical oversight and initiate, plan, implement, and coordinate activities throughout the life of the project.
• Experience designing engineering solutions and alternative design options to meet customer requirements and provide guidance to junior engineers in the design and development of engineering solutions.
• Experience in deconflicting complex functional requirements into underlying technical requirements and recommend “best fit” allocation of those requirements.
• Experience in conducting technical research on such topics as operational guidelines, best practices, and international standards, and develop procedures for installation of hardware, software, or network components.
• Experience overseeing the design, evaluation, selection, implementation, and support of development and production support tools and platforms.
• Experience overseeing the effective integration and interoperability of disparate capabilities developed by separate service providers.
• Experience formulating enterprise data best practices to facilitate common standards and leverage existing and new collaboration capabilities.
• Experience using data services and big-data architectures, data organization, retention, and disposition standards, and processes.

Required:

• Bachelor's Degree (Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Data Mining).

Preferred:
• Data Governance

title: Data Analyst, Senior

description:
About the position

The Optical Data Analyst at ASML is responsible for developing and improving image processing algorithms for metrology processes related to ultra-high precision flat optics. This role involves integrating algorithms into software packages, maintaining version control, performing software testing, and supporting engineering and manufacturing teams in achieving nanometer scale precision. The position requires collaboration with multidisciplinary teams and a commitment to delivering high-quality results in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities
• Develop and improve image processing algorithms to extract nanometer flatness information from interferometer data.
,
• Integrate algorithms from developers into image processing software packages for analysis and process development cycles.
,
• Maintain version-controlled software packages for multiple product generations.
,
• Perform software testing to identify application, algorithm, and software bugs.
,
• Validate, verify, and regression test software to ensure it meets business and technical requirements.
,
• Develop and execute a roadmap of analysis, software, and systems to mitigate product and process risk and prevent software performance issues.
,
• Lead the design team in software analysis tool development to find solutions to difficult technical problems efficiently.
,
• Develop, maintain, and improve database structures and capabilities.
,
• Write MATLAB scripts to search, analyze, and plot data from the database.
,
• Support query code to interrogate data for manufacturing and engineering needs.
,
• Support image analysis on data and derive conclusions.
,
• Travel approximately 10% to Europe, Asia, and within the US.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Optical Engineering with a minimum of 4 years of experience in developing signal processing and image processing algorithms and software; or a Master's degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or a PhD degree in similar disciplines.
,
• Experience with software such as MATLAB, Python, and C/C++.
,
• Experienced in scientific image/signal/data processing algorithms, statistics, and software development.
,
• Theoretical expertise in image/signal/data processing, Transfer Function Convolution, filtering, and data fitting techniques.
,
• Clear understanding of optical measurement techniques like interferometry, scatterometry, optical sensors, and imaging systems.
,
• Familiarity with Software Configuration Management.

Nice-to-haves
• Experience with software configuration management tools.
,
• Knowledge of additional programming languages or software tools related to data analysis.

Benefits
• Competitive salary and performance bonuses.
,
• Health insurance coverage.
,
• 401(k) retirement savings plan with company matching contributions.
,
• Paid time off and holidays.
,
• Opportunities for professional development and continued education.

description:
Role Summary:

The Compensation & Benefits Analyst is responsible for compensation and benefits analysis and administration. This position provides subject matter expertise in: compensation, benefits, compiling data/reports, compliance, policy & procedure development, research, and communication. In addition, this position maintains high standards for HR customer service and provides support for the accuracy and maintenance of data in various HR systems.

Key Duties & Accountabilities:
• Conducts compensation analysis in alignment with CRICO philosophy, ensuring external and internal equity, including performing surveys to analyze market & industry wide trends, analyzing new & existing positions to determine appropriate classification, and salary level. In reviewing jobs for analysis, will update descriptions as appropriate.
• Leads annual merit and bonus planning cycle to ensure compensation is equitable, consistent and accurate by effectively presenting complex compensation data and insights to diverse audiences, facilitating informed decision-making and strategic alignment. Will also provide compensation support to the Compensation Committee.
• Provide guidance to managers and staff regarding benefits and compensation
• Conducts a variety of HR data analytics including various workforce statistics, benefit analysis, risk assessments, etc.
• Serves as backup to HR Administrator for bi-weekly payroll processing in collaboration with Finance and performs spot checks to ensure accuracy. Also, participates in year-end payroll process.
• Supports Senior HR Manager with benefits administration and annual open enrollment benefits cycle by participating in benefit strategy discussions, supporting online enrollment and employees. Also, assists with benefits and leave administration.
• Participates in and supports 401K audit
• Maintains up-to-date knowledge of HR practices, laws and regulations, and best practices in the industry; remains current: performs research
• Helps mitigate CRICO risk due to HR practices
• Participates in special projects and HR related committees
• Other related duties and ad hoc projects as required by position

Minimum Requirements:

Knowledge: Education, Experience, & Skills:
• BA/BS degree or equivalent; HR focus preferred
• 5+ years compensation experience required
• 3+ years benefits experience preferred
• In depth understanding of compensation structures, job evaluation, and salary surveys
• Understanding of federal and state regulations impacting compensation and benefits
• HRIS, and/or payroll experience required
• Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
• Proficient in utilizing data analysis tools and methodologies to extract actionable insights, including the acquisition and management of data.
• Capable of presenting the results of analyses and statistical information for specific audiences.
• Strong mathematical and statistical skills
• Precision in preparing reports and ensuring data accuracy
• Strong written and verbal communication skills for reporting and presentations
• Good judgment with high levels of and integrity and problem-solving skills
• Discrete; ability to maintain highly confidential & sensitive information
title: Compensation & Benefits Analyst

description:
Job Title: Analyst, Major League Development
Department: Baseball Strategy & Operations
Reports to: Senior Director, Baseball Strategy & Operations
FLSA: Salary, Exempt

Job Summary:
This position works closely with the Major League coaching staff, Analytics, and Player Development departments to develop and maintain player development plans, use data and technology to evaluate player performance, and build and maintain digital tools to track player improvement.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Work closely with Major League coaching staff to create, execute, and document player plans.
• Collaborate with Major League coaching, Player Development, and Analytics to build and maintain digital tools to assist in coaching of players and evaluate player performance.
• Provide Major League coaching staff with materials to be presented to players for purposes of player improvement.
• Complete ad hoc and systematic research using SQL and R/Python to enhance in-game strategy and/or player improvement.
• Manage and operate various portable tracking technologies to assist with player improvement.
• Work with Analytics to develop and maintain new and existing advance materials.
• Assist Major League coaching staff with preparation of qualitative and quantitative advance materials, as needed.

Desired Qualifications:
• Completion of Bachelor’s degree, with a preference but not limited to Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Operations Research, Statistics, or related field.
• Experience working with and/or coaching professional baseball players.
• Prior experience creating, executing, and documenting individualized player development plans.
• Proficiency with BATS video software, TrackMan and portable tracking technologies.
• Proficiency with SQL, R/Python, and Microsoft Office.
• Familiarity with advance materials for a Major League club.
• Exceptional organizational, written, and oral communication skills.
• Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate with players and staff members of various backgrounds and responsibilities.
• Willingness to work non-traditional hours (nights, weekends, holidays) as dictated by Orioles and MLB schedule.
• Ability to travel for Major League spring training and road trips.
• Applicants with various and/or non-traditional educational background and experience will be considered and are encouraged to apply.

DISCLAIMER:
The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the employee in this position. The duties listed do not represent an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of a person in this position.

It is the policy of the Baltimore Orioles to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race (including hair textures, afro hairstyles, or protective hairstyles), color, national origin or ancestry, religion or creed, gender or sex (including pregnancy), age, disability, citizenship status, marital status, veteran’s status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

The anticipated salary for this role is $65,000 - $100,000 annually depending on experience.

The Baltimore Orioles are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits for our employees.

The Baltimore Orioles provide generous benefits, health insurance (single and family), vision and dental coverage, life insurance, concession/merchandise discounts, free parking and complimentary baseball tickets to home games. 401(k) plan with discretionary employer match available after one year of service and 1,000 hours is also available.

title: Analyst, Major League Development

description:
The Sr. Audience Data Analyst will be responsible for tracking and developing performance insights across social media and audio operations for our growing portfolio of sports, news and lifestyle podcasts and social brands.

The ideal candidate understands the nuances of social media and podcast audience habits and growth strategies, and has the ability to derive actionable insights from data provided by the social platforms.

The Sr. Audience Data Analyst will work closely with executive leaders, audio and social content producers, sales, finance, accounting and other departments, ensuring all departments have needed performance insights, up-to-date analytics and recommendations on opportunities for improvement.

This is not just a reporting and analysis role. Excelling in this position will require proactively using data to identify audience trends and opportunities to improve production, content selection and marketing strategies for optimal audience reach, growth and advertiser value.

You will be working directly with teams that produce some of the biggest shows and brands in the country, and success will mean having a direct impact on making them even better.

Responsibilities
• Analyze changes in audience and revenue patterns and recommend actions to grow overall audience engagement.
• Identify audience interest trends across social media platforms to identify unmet areas of opportunity for content production teams.
• Deliver regular reporting and analysis of social and audio business performance.
• Fluent in the language of Digital, Social, Podcasts, Sales, News, Sports, Data Science and other divisions without being afraid to ask questions or dig into issues to bring about solutions.
• Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that track key metrics and provide a clear view of performance and trends.
• Assist with creating data assets and visualizations for sales presentations or internal reporting.
• Work with content production teams to highlight data-supported growth opportunities and train producers to access needed data on their own.
• Stay on top of general social media trends, including new features, capabilities and platforms, ensuring analysis tools and strategies are always ready to measure and take advantage of such changes.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in marketing, data science, business, journalism, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a data analyst, researcher or similar role in a media company.
• Strong understanding of social media platforms and audience growth strategies.
• Excellent analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools.
• Expert in utilizing social analytics and APIs from Facebook, Instagram, Threads, X, TikTok, YouTube, and other social platforms.
• Familiarity with podcast analytics from platforms like Art19 or Megaphone
• Strong writing and communication skills, and ability to work collaboratively with various teams.
• Ability to derive actionable insights from complex data sets.
• Knowledge of sports leagues, teams and sports landscape is a plus.
• Self-motivated with an ability to drive research and insights without detailed direction.
• Proficiency using Excel and data visualization tools (Power BI, etc.) to present insights clearly.
• Familiarity with Sprout is a plus.
• Able to travel if requested, approximately 5% of the time.

This position requires five days per week in the office, with flexibility to accommodate occasional remote work or adjusted hours as needed.

Sinclair is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and a drug free workplace. Employment practices will not be influenced or affected by virtue of an applicant's or employee's race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

About Us

Sinclair, Inc. (Nasdaq: SBGI) is a diversified media company and a leading provider of local news and sports. The Company owns, operates and/or provides services to 185 television stations in 86 markets affiliated with all the major broadcast networks; and owns Tennis Channel and multicast networks Comet, CHARGE!, TBD., and The Nest. Sinclair's content is delivered via multiple platforms, including over-the-air, multi-channel video program distributors, and the nation's largest streaming aggregator of local news content, NewsON. The Company regularly uses its website as a key source of Company information which can be accessed at www.sbgi.net.

About the Team

The life-blood of our organization is our people. We have a compelling story, a goal-oriented culture, and we take really good care of people. How good? Here is a glimpse: great benefits, open door policy, upward mobility and a strong desire to see you succeed. Ready to be part of a winning team? Let’s talk.

The base salary compensation range for this role is $100,000 to $150,000. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate’s relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location. Full time positions are eligible for benefits that include participation in a retirement plan, quarterly and annual incentive plan bonuses, life and disability insurance, health, dental and vision plans, flexible spending accounts, 15 paid vacation days, 2 paid personal days, 9 paid holidays, 40 hours of paid sick leave, parental leave, and employee stock purchase plan.
title: Senior Audience Data Analyst

description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and innovative Lead Data Analyst to join our team at Vanguard. As a Lead Data Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining data pipelines, extracting insights from data sets, and designing and developing analytics solutions. You must have a passion for data and a commitment to the continual development of your analytic skills.The ideal candidate for this position must possess a combination of technical and business skills. You must have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically—all while maintaining a focus on delivering value to the business. The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics, and experience in predictive analytics, data engineering, and data mining.At Vanguard, we believe that data is one of the most valuable resources for driving business decisions. We are looking for an individual who is excited to work with us in leveraging data to create competitive advantages for our organization. If you have a passion for data and a commitment to excellence, we want you on our team.

Responsibilities:
Design and develop analytics solutions using various data sets
Maintain data pipelines to ensure that data is easily accessible and reliable
Extract meaningful insights from data sets and present them in a clear and concise manner
Utilize predictive analytics, data engineering, and data mining to develop insights
Identify areas of improvement in existing data processes and suggest innovative solutions
Work collaboratively with other team members to ensure successful implementation of data projects
Remain up to date with the latest advancements in data analytics and technology
Prepare periodic reports to track progress and ensure successful delivery of data projects
Monitor and analyze data trends to identify potential opportunities
Develop visualizations to communicate results in a clear and understandable manner

Vanguard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Derivatives Risk Senior Data Analyst –  Investment Management Company

description:
Operations Optimization and Enablement (OOE)

One key element of the OOE is– The goal of the Strategic Ledger Program is to implement a new global financial accounting and general ledger platform that provides a daily ledger in every legal entity. A single, universal Ledger with a unified chart of accounts, reducing approx. 250 accounting engines to 10-20 accounting hubs. We will establish a single global Ledger operating model and end-to-end business process automated through Oracle, replacing multiple manual processes. Migrating from ~100 ledgers and ledger standards today with a single global Citi ledger design template, initially rolled out in CBNA London Branch, before expanding to EMEA, Asia, LATAM and NAM. The program will run through to the end of 2030. Operations will be part of the end-to-end process and the OOE team will be the focal point to define, establish, and implement best in class operational capabilities aligned to the future state architecture, notably an intraday cash subledger which will service both internal and client cash requirements.

Key Responsibilities:
• Capability Building: Lead the development and implementation of core data analytics capabilities within our division. Define the strategic roadmap for data analytics initiatives and drive the execution of key projects to enhance our analytical capabilities.
• Talent Development: Mentor, coach, and develop junior talent within the data analytics team. Provide guidance and support to foster skill development, career growth, and a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
• Data Strategy Implementation: Align data analytics initiatives with the organization's overall data strategy. Work closely with leadership to ensure that data analytics efforts are aligned with business objectives and priorities.
• Collaboration and Partnership: Forge strong partnerships with business stakeholders to understand their needs, challenges, and priorities. Collaborate closely to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business value and inform decision-making.
• Value-Added Recommendations: Translate data insights into actionable recommendations for senior executive audiences. Develop compelling narratives, visualizations, and presentations to communicate insights and drive alignment on key strategic initiatives.
• Continuous Improvement: Drive a culture of continuous improvement within the data analytics team. Regularly assess and optimize processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance efficiency, effectiveness, and impact.

Qualifications:

10-12 + years of experience:
• Effective communication
• Imaginative and practical solution design
• Self-motivated, disciplined and accountable
• Problem solving to address challenges, and obstacles that arise during implementation, identifying solutions and making informed decisions.
• Collaborative team participant, promoting teamwork, trust, and mutual respect.
• Decision making - decisive & data driven to provide clear guidance and alignment.
• Adaptability: Ability to navigate the team through ambiguity and embrace change.

Technical Skills:

10-12 + years of experience:
• Domain expertise: Across Operations and Finance functions and tools. Expert knowledge in end-to-end transaction lifecycle process.
• Change management: Large, complex implementations and transformation program expertise in finance and or operations.
• Data Migration: Extensive knowledge in migration techniques and tools to ensure seamless transition of data from legacy to new GL platform.
• Process Improvement: Extensive knowledge of process improvement with a track record of streamlining operational or finance process.
• General ledger Expertise: Good understanding of GL, systems, their functionalities, and best practice implementing.
• Business Knowledge: Knowledge of both Markets and Banking products from transaction booking to cash settlement and controls therein.

Education:
• Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred

title: Operations Senior Data Analyst SVP

description:
We're currently hiring for remote team members in the following states: DC, DE, GA, MA, MD, NC, NH, NJ, OH, PA, SC, UT, and VA.

We’re AWeber - a remote-first company that helps small businesses around the world form meaningful connections with their customers and grow their businesses using our marketing communication software. We are fanatical about small businesses and we hope you are too!

As our Lead Data Analyst, you will work with Product, Marketing, and Customer Solutions teams to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights. You will help these teams make informed decisions so they can better serve our customers and drive business growth. Sound exciting? Well, that's because it is!

Each day you will:
• Collaborate with stakeholders: Partner with teams across Marketing, Product, Customer Solutions, and Finance to understand their data analysis needs and deliver effective solutions.
• Conduct thorough data analysis: Dive deep into data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights, translating them into actionable business initiatives and strategic recommendations.
• Automate reporting processes: Enhance data collection efficiency by automating reporting tasks and improving dashboard visualizations using tools like PostHog, Redash and SQL

To thrive as our Data Analyst, you would:
• Be proactive and self-motivated: You take initiative to identify opportunities for data-driven improvements and are eager to learn and implement new technologies and methodologies.
• Have strong technical expertise: You are proficient in SQL and experienced with analytics tools such as Posthog, Mixpanel, or Amplitude, as well as visualization platforms like Redash, Looker, or Tableau.
• Excel in analytical and problem-solving skills: You have a keen eye for detail and can transform complex data sets into meaningful insights.
• Communicate effectively: You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, enabling you to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders clearly and effectively.
• Collaborate well with others: You are a team player with strong interpersonal skills, capable of building effective partnerships across various departments.
• Thrive in a remote environment: You are comfortable working independently in a remote setting, managing multiple projects simultaneously, and staying connected with your team.
• Be passionate about data and small businesses: You are enthusiastic about leveraging data to drive business success and excited about helping small businesses grow.

Qualifications:
• Experience: Minimum of 5 years in data analytics
• Education: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred).

If you're ready to make a significant impact by helping small businesses succeed through data-driven insights, we'd love to hear from you!

About AWeber:

AWeber’s gone remote! Since our beginning, AWeber has been committed to creating a safe, productive environment for all of our team members. Our commitment to deliver powerfully-simple email marketing software for small businesses will never change. We will find new ways to continue living our core values and use the latest and greatest technology to collaborate, grow, and ultimately create remarkable experiences for our customers - all from remote locations.

Even with this change, our mission has and never will waver. We remain dedicated to strengthening our culture and connecting people in remarkable ways so they can continue living their dreams, executing on their passions, and growing their businesses.

AWeber Benefits:
• 100% Remote - work where you feel most comfortable and productive.
• Strong culture that supports flexibility, entrepreneurialism, and collaboration. Think we should be doing something different? Share your feedback! We’re looking for you to add your AWesomeness to our culture.
• We have some other pretty cool benefits to make your life easier:
• 100% Company Paid PPO medical, dental, vision insurance (spousal and domestic partner benefits available).
• 4-7 weeks of paid time off and holidays (based on tenure).
• 4 week paid sabbatical (based on tenure).
• 401K retirement plan with 4% company match.
• Company Profit Share.
• Tuition reimbursement, conferences, and learning opportunities.
• Gym Memberships Reimbursement.
• Company Paid Short Term Disability Insurance.
• Company Paid Life Insurance.
• Additional Supplemental Benefits (Long Term Disability, Critical Illness, and Additional Life Insurance).
• State of the art equipment.

description:
Company Description

Computech Corporation provides IT and consulting services to various customers across the globe. We are a Minority Certified Company with over 15 years of industry experience. Our global delivery model and proven track record enable companies to realize improved business efficiency and increased profitability.

Job Description

General Description:
• Part of the PepsiCo Quality Program (PQP), global business teams are classifying specifications/ingredients to enable food safety hazard assessment with a focus on FSMA (Food Safety Modernization Act) compliance.
• The identified resource will support sectors/business units with the mapping exercise as appropriate and coordinate incoming change requests for changes and re-assessments.
• Keen insights regarding raw materials in the manufacture of food and beverage will enable analysis of scientific research and identification of hazards associated with food materials.
• Fulfill Data Steward responsibilities in responding to change management of the material classification tool.
• Act as a point person/clearing house contact as questions arise and address SME teams when needed.
• Collaborate with business sectors globally to train, update, and communicate application of the classification tool and changes to the tool.
• Support enhancement of the hazard analysis with internal and external tools and data systems.
• Support automation project by liaising with database developers.
• Conduct user acceptance testing.
• Support accurate and timely mapping of ingredients to the new material classification.
• Maintain master files and adhere to document control procedures.
• Support related Food Safety technical services as needed.

Qualifications

Skills/Qualifications:
• Certification in or working knowledge of Food Safety and Quality systems
• Crisis management / recall management experience

Additional Information

Requirements:
• Knowledge of food materials and associated biological and chemical hazards and a general understanding of physical, chemical, and biological hazards associated with different categories of food and beverage ingredients.
• Experience in food safety, microbiology, and/or toxicology is preferred.
• Exposure to product development, manufacturing, and/or supply quality is also desirable (5+ years).
• Practical knowledge of food ingredients (how they are grown, cultivated, harvested, processed, distributed) and risk assessment thereof (5+ years)
• Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel; high frequency user experience with database/ product lifecycle management tools (e.g., Product Vision, SAP) (5+ years)
• Basic understanding of the Food Safety Modernization Act, domestic and international regulatory requirements
• Influential written and verbal communication skills; excellent organizational skills

title: Healthcare Data Analyst

description:
About the position

Noblis is seeking Aviation Data Analysts to support the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Air Traffic Systems and Surveillance Services directorates within the Program Management Organization (PMO). Employees will provide services related to managing and analyzing aviation-related data to improve operational efficiency, safety, and decision-making processes in the National Airspace System (NAS). For over 25 years, Noblis has provided specialized engineering, acquisition, and program management services to the FAA, playing a key role in the acquisition and implementation of mission-critical systems and capabilities across the Air Traffic Organization (ATO) and the Office of NextGen (ANG). We are seeking passionate and committed professionals ready to contribute their expertise towards advancing the National Airspace System (NAS) in alignment with the FAA's forward-looking vision for aviation. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to projects that streamline the acquisition and deployment of next-generation air traffic management and surveillance systems, improve infrastructure at airports and in the airspace, and support the integration of unmanned aircraft systems and commercial space ventures. Your work will directly influence the FAA's ability to adapt to future growth and technological shifts, ensuring the aerospace system remains the safest and most efficient worldwide. Come and be a part of our dynamic team, where your contributions will not only advance the aviation industry but also contribute to a safer, more sustainable future in air travel. Apply now and take flight towards a rewarding career that promises growth, innovation, and collaboration at the forefront of aviation technology.

Responsibilities
• Review aviation-related information to assist in decision-making about flight routes, spending practices, employee efficiency, safety, and aviation regulations, including national security.
,
• Use data to make predictions and estimations related to all aspects of aviation.
,
• Perform operational analysis and develop concepts of operations.
,
• Analyze architecture, overall systems design, concepts of operations, and implementation plans.
,
• Conduct research and analysis that meets quality standards on focused, structured questions.
,
• Apply standard, routine, and well-established analytic methodologies to produce logical, traceable, objective, and unbiased analysis.
,
• Collect data, create metrics, and perform associated analyses.
,
• Query databases using SQL and classify and summarize data for the preparation and submission of reports.
,
• Clearly document and review standard operating procedures, policies, event reports, best practices, and lessons learned.
,
• Effectively communicate technical and non-technical data to various audiences.

Requirements
• Successfully pass an FAA background investigation/verification and receive a successful final suitability determination.
,
• Ability to construct effective briefings using MS PowerPoint and intermediate to advanced skills with MS Word and Excel.
,
• Proficiency in analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and presenting data effectively.
,
• Skilled in programming (R or Python), statistics, SQL, data visualization, and other data analysis fundamentals.
,
• Experience applying data analytic methods (Statistical Analysis, Predictive Modeling, Time Series Analysis, Geospatial Analysis, and Data Visualization) in an operational environment.
,
• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
,
• Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Nice-to-haves
• Advanced degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Information Systems.
,
• Experience designing and implementing sustainable Business Intelligence solutions (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, D3.js) in an operational environment.
,
• Experience with Big Data technologies and platforms such as Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, and NoSQL Databases for the storing, processing and managing of large structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data sets.
,
• Ability to work both independently and as part of a team; Proactive, solution-oriented, with exceptional time management skills.
,
• FAA experience highly desired.

Benefits
• Health insurance coverage
,
• Life insurance coverage
,
• Disability insurance coverage
,
• Paid leave
,
• Professional development
,
• Tuition assistance
,
• Work-life programs

title: Data Analyst(Remote)

description:
Welcome to Analog Devices, a world leader in innovative semiconductor solutions. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead Financial/Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Lead Financial/Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving financial and data analysis to support our company's growth and success. We are looking for someone who is passionate about numbers, has a keen eye for detail, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. If you have a strong background in financial analysis and data management, along with excellent leadership and communication skills, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us and be a part of our mission to shape the future of technology.

Conduct financial analysis: Perform in-depth financial analysis including forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis to support strategic decision making.

Manage and analyze data: Utilize various financial and data management tools to gather, organize, and analyze large sets of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

Develop financial models: Build financial models to support business initiatives, evaluate potential investments, and assess risks and opportunities.

Provide recommendations: Use financial and data analysis to provide recommendations to senior management for areas of improvement, cost reduction, and revenue growth.

Ensure data accuracy: Develop and maintain data integrity protocols to ensure accuracy and consistency of financial data across the organization.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with teams across the organization, including sales, marketing, and operations, to understand business needs and provide financial insights and support.

Lead and mentor junior analysts: Provide guidance and leadership to junior analysts, delegate tasks, and ensure timely and accurate completion of projects.

Stay updated on industry trends: Keep abreast of industry trends, best practices, and regulations related to financial analysis and data management to ensure the company remains competitive.

Communicate findings: Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders in a clear, concise, and visually appealing manner.

Continuously improve processes: Identify opportunities to improve and streamline financial analysis and data management processes, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and accuracy.

Analog Devices is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Be a part of the nationwide law enforcement initiative that removes the tools of crime from criminal organizations, depriving wrongdoers of proceeds from their crime and impacting the infrastructure of criminal enterprises.

FSA Federal (FSA) is focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security. We currently have a vacancy for a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). If you are looking for a meaningful, mission driven career, Join FSA!

Responsibilities
• Receives, gathers, analyzes, and organizes information from multiple sources.

This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation
• * NOTE: The 20% pay differential is dependent upon the customer's order for services and requires an Active Top-Secret security clearance.

Agency Overview

The mission of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is to protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States. FBI investigates a broad range of criminal violations, integrating the use of asset forfeiture into its overall strategy to eliminate targeted criminal enterprises. The FBI has successfully used asset forfeiture in White Collar Crime, Organized Crime, Drug, Violent Crime and Terrorism investigations.

Comprehensive benefits are offered with greater choice and flexibility to support your health, work-life balance, and professional growth. A package providing employee only coverage can be built around our basic plans at $0 employee cost for: Medical, Dental, Vision, Term Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Employee Assistance Program. description:
About the position

Volt is seeking multiple Customer Service Data Analysts for an immediate opportunity with a leading automotive manufacturer in Fountain Valley, CA. In this role, you will collaborate with management to develop and implement standards and procedures aimed at enhancing dealer sales and service operations. Your primary focus will be on improving dealership performance, particularly for those dealers who are currently underperforming. This will involve the creation of process and product initiatives designed to elevate their operational standards. As a Customer Service Data Analyst, you will be responsible for developing tracking tools that measure process improvements and assess the performance of internal departments, divisions, and dealers against established objectives. You will support the Senior Manager of Retail & Customer Feedback as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the Retail Experience Survey Interference Program, as well as manage the unusual activity report. This includes investigating, discussing, and documenting any issues related to survey interference and unusual activities. Your role will also involve acting as a clearinghouse for various processes, maintaining region lists, and ensuring that signed forms are properly documented. You will assist management in retail-facing customer feedback programs, which includes collaborating with and training field representatives on specific aspects of the Retail Experience Survey Program. Additionally, you will be responsible for reporting on the Retail Experience Survey Interference Program, documenting contact reports, and improving existing processes related to these programs. You will follow established procedures for the survey interference program and enhance the understanding of unusual activity reports among field representatives, utilizing tools like AdobeSign for dealer interference strike letters. This position operates on a hybrid schedule, requiring three days onsite and two days remote, with working hours from Monday to Friday, 8 AM to 5 PM. The positions are temporary for six months, providing a valuable opportunity to gain experience with a top company known for hiring talent.

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with management to develop and implement standards and procedures for dealer sales and service operations.
,
• Create tracking tools to measure process improvements and assess dealer performance against objectives.
,
• Support the Sr. Manager, Retail & Customer Feedback as a Subject Matter Expert for the Retail Experience Survey Interference Program.
,
• Investigate and document discussions surrounding survey interference and unusual activity.
,
• Act as a clearinghouse for processes, region lists, and signed forms.
,
• Assist management with retail-facing customer feedback programs and train field representatives on the Retail Experience Survey Program.
,
• Report on the Retail Experience Survey Interference Program and maintain contact report documentation.
,
• Improve current processes related to customer feedback programs and survey interference.
,
• Follow process steps for the survey interference program and enhance understanding of unusual activity reports with field representatives.
,
• Leverage AdobeSign for dealer interference strike letters.

Requirements
• Three years of experience in a similar field preferred.
,
• Prior experience at an automotive dealership and/or OEM is preferred.
,
• Experience in customer service and process improvement preferred.
,
• Knowledge of automotive dealer terminology (e.g., ROs, RDRs, Customer Pay, Warranty, DMS) is helpful.

title: Customer Service Data Analyst

description:
About the position

Suffolk Construction Company, Inc. is seeking an Operations Portfolio Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role is crucial for enhancing project performance monitoring across all stages of our portfolio and individual projects. The Operations Portfolio Data Analyst will work closely with our data and operational excellence teams to analyze trends, report on portfolio and project health, and drive data-driven decisions in collaboration with leadership. The ideal candidate will possess a solid understanding of construction processes and demonstrate strong analytical skills. We are looking for someone who is intellectually curious, a critical thinker, and motivated by uncovering truths that drive impact. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently while managing multiple ongoing analyses are essential for success in this role. In this position, you will continually monitor operational dashboards, identifying trends and patterns that can inform decision-making. You will track the performance of business processes, pinpointing areas for improvement or risk. Regular reporting on operational trends, particularly at the intersection of safety, financial forecasting, and operational performance, will be a key responsibility. You will convene forums with peers to review trends and provide actionable intelligence to project teams, actively engaging with regional and national leadership to provide insights and escalate issues as necessary. Collaboration across teams will be vital to enhance data understanding and application, and you will work with data engineering and visualization teams to improve data quality, accuracy, and reliability. Over time, you will develop deep subject matter expertise on Operations data, including all elements of the Project Management Dashboard, and generate insights through analytics.

description:
Tactibit Technologies provides innovative information technology, cybersecurity, and cloud support services to the Federal Government. We support some of the nation's most critical and demanding projects including satellite operations, critical infrastructure, and search and rescue. We are a diverse team of hands-on professionals dedicated to solving problems and developing innovative solutions in support of our customers' critical missions. Our success is dependent on our inclusive, collaborative environment with a shared commitment to excellence in everything we do.

About The Data Technician Position

We are looking for a talented Data Technician to join our team remotely. You will support mission-critical systems that receive, process, disseminate, and store petabytes of environmental and scientific data collected from Earth orbiting satellites daily. You will collect, review, and input data into a computer processing system and review/audit output data. You should have a deep understanding of enterprise and/or scientific data sets and experience managing large-scale data.

Data Technician Responsibilities Are
• Research, design, deploy, and document new data management tools and techniques
• Manage large-scale data sets from modern ground systems and applications
• Support data management processing including data migration, backup, and recovery
• Provide reporting metrics to management and customers
• Assist with troubleshooting issues
• Work with cross-functional teams to ensure sound data management practices throughout the software development lifecycle

Data Technician Requirements Are
• 8+ years of enterprise data management experience
• Experience with GIS data
• Strong understanding of data management processes and technologies
• Experience using scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Java, PowerShell, Ruby, etc.
• Strong analytical skills and ability to work under pressure
• Must be able to pass a full background investigation and obtain a security badge to enter the applicable government facility

Desired Qualifications Are
• Experience working with AWS services or AWS cloud certification(s) are a plus
• Experience in high-performance computing, machine learning, artificial intelligence applications and frameworks in a cloud environment
• Familiarity with environmental or scientific data processing
• Familiarity with modern agile software development principles, practices, methods, and tools
• Experience with version control systems (preferably Git) and issue tracking software (preferably Jira)
• BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field preferred, but not required
• Industry certifications such as AWS certifications

HJF is seeking a Data Analyst/Biostatistician to support the Center for the Study of Traumatic Stress (CSTS) within the Department of Psychiatry of the Uniformed Services University (USU). This position is located at the Rockledge Office in Bethesda, MD. HJF provides scientific, technical and programmatic support services to CSTS. US Citizenship is required for this position.

The Center’s work addresses a wide scope of trauma and disaster exposure and their outcomes, including post traumatic stress disorder, suicide, depression, and grief. The Center works in a public health framework and has substantial “big data” projects. Responsibilities are to provide biostatistical support for clinical and/or laboratory research. This involves performing statistical analysis on data collected from clinical trials and/or research studies.

title: Data / Business Analyst

description:
About the position

We are looking for an experienced Acoustic Data Analyst with demonstrated experience supporting DoD requirements to join our team at Naval Surface Warfare Center Carderock Division (NSWCCD), West Bethesda, MD! As an Acoustic Data Analyst, you will apply your knowledge to support NSWCCD laboratory operations and acoustic calibration and certification efforts. You will work with a team of driven, supportive, and highly skilled professionals. This position offers a robust benefits package that includes an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) and the flexibility to manage your work hours and personal needs with a single accrual leave plan. A week in the life of an Acoustic Data Analyst involves processing and reporting the analysis results of acoustic data collected by recording systems during SONAR groom and calibration events. You will generate Sonar Calibration (SOCAL) reports and provide support for the TUBA Acoustic Reporting and Processing System (TARPS) laboratory efforts, including developing, integrating, testing, and sustaining upgrades to the acoustic processing systems. Additionally, you will support NSWCCD engineers in the development of new acoustic data processing equipment and associated Research and Development (R&D) efforts. Your role will also include supporting the development of technical documentation and procedures, providing In-Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) support, supporting fleet training efforts, and providing engineering support to TUBA system development and upgrade efforts. You will assist NSWCCD in analyzing measurement data in support of generic and platform certification efforts, as well as to investigate problems and verify proper system behavior.

Responsibilities
• Process and report the analysis results of acoustic data collected by recording systems during SONAR groom and calibration events.
,
• Generate Sonar Calibration (SOCAL) reports.
,
• Provide support for the TUBA Acoustic Reporting and Processing System (TARPS) laboratory efforts, including developing, integrating, testing, and sustaining upgrades to the acoustic processing systems.
,
• Support NSWCCD engineers in the development of new acoustic data processing equipment and associated Research and Development (R&D) efforts.
,
• Support development of technical documentation and procedures, provide In-Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) support, support fleet training efforts, and provide engineering support to TUBA system development and upgrade efforts.
,
• Assist NSWCCD in analyzing measurement data in support of generic and platform certification efforts, as well as to investigate problems and verify proper system behavior.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in engineering or physics OR three years of U.S. Navy fleet operational experience with at-sea measurement trials.
,
• 3 - 7 years of technical experience with acoustic data acquisition systems which process, analyze, and report on beam noise, FFT, time series, PC-IMAT/STK, K-OMEGA, or transmission loss recorded acoustic data.
,
• Have an active Secret security clearance.
,
• Two years of experience conducting R&D efforts to support the design and evaluation of time series data recorded from sonar systems/sensors for post processing and analysis.
,
• Proficiency in MS Office tools, LINUX RED HAT, MS SQL, MATLAB, JIRA, ACROBAT, ADOBE AUDITION, or AUDACITY.
,
• Two years of experience with system analysis of large Navy sonar radiated noise, self-noise, and structure-borne noise systems, including acoustical signal acquisition, transmission, telemetry and processing subsystem, and numerical and acoustic model development, implementation, and data analysis.
,
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
,
• Excellent interpersonal and listening skills; Team player.
,
• Ability to meet deadlines on assigned tasks and responsibilities.
,
• Multi-task oriented and capable of prioritizing.

Nice-to-haves

Benefits
• Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
,
• Healthcare benefits
,
• Paid leave
,
• Retirement plans (including ESOP and 401k)
,
• Insurance programs
,
• Education and training assistance

description:

Be a part of the nationwide law enforcement initiative that removes the tools of crime from criminal organizations, depriving wrongdoers of proceeds from their crime and impacting the infrastructure of criminal enterprises.

EnProVera, owned and operated by government veterans with extensive backgrounds in Homeland Security, Law Enforcement, the Military, and the Intelligence Community, has a vacancy for a Data Analyst. In this role you will be supporting the overall mission of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). #EARLYCAREER

Responsibilities
• Provide organization and management of case files
• Review data (completeness of information, proper execution)
• Extract data from data base
• Obtain additional information from other investigative agencies/data base
• Establish/maintain physical file
• Prepare notices/advertisements
• Receive, suspense petitions, claims, process sharing requests
• Reconcile inconsistencies
• Prepare declarations
• Gather information and organize investigative package
• Verify case files and case tracking system
• Maintain internal status information on the disposition of all forfeited assets
• Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data
• Conduct and reconcile inventories
• Distribute and receive documents
• Assist lead analyst or official in obtaining/collecting all documents/information to complete case file
• Provide administrative information and assistance concerning case to other investigative agencies, local law enforcement agencies, US Attorney, and other DOJ processing units, and higher headquarters
• Extract data from agency data base for management and program reports
• Perform word processing relevant to case documentation
• Perform data entry relevant to case

NOTE: Applicants with an Active Top Secret Clearance Preferred

Requirements
• High School diploma, bachelor's Degree preferred
• Ability to review and analyze data and information from multiple sources
• Ability to establish case/project files
• Ability to enter and retrieve data from data bases
• Ability to prepare and format management reports
• Ability to manipulate, transfer, and compute and print information
• Ability to create and manipulate spreadsheets
• Ability to prepare and correct reports and correspondence using word processing software
• Ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Security Access

This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation.
• * NOTE: The 20% pay differential is dependent upon the customer's order for services and requires an Active Top-Secret security clearance.

Agency Overview

The mission of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is to protect the American people and uphold the Constitution of the United States. FBI investigates a broad range of criminal violations, integrating the use of asset forfeiture into its overall strategy to eliminate targeted criminal enterprises. The FBI has successfully used asset forfeiture in White Collar Crime, Organized Crime, Drug, Violent Crime and Terrorism investigations.

Benefits Overview

At EnProVera, we recognize the diverse needs of our employees and strive to provide an excellent package to help meet those needs. Comprehensive benefits are offered with greater choice and flexibility to support your health, work-life balance, and professional growth. A package providing employee only coverage can be built around our basic plans at $0 employee cost for: Medical, Dental, Vision, Term Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Employee Assistance Program.

Ensure the Data Warehouse is operating efficiently and effectively, reflective of the business requirements Ensure BI and data solutions adhere to security, regulatory, and audit standards, including ISO27001 and SOC2-Type2. Required Experience: Proficient in Snowflake, PowerBI, Azure Data Factory, SQL, and DAX. Experience with MS DF&O, Power Platform, Azure LogicApps, and Data Lake. Skilled in extracting and transforming data from RESTful APIs and formats including JSON, CSV, and Parquet. Familiarity with Azure Cloud, Power Platform, Dynamics 365 F&O, and Cognitive Services. Strong ability to translate business needs into technical solutions. Expertise in data mapping, architecture, and transformation. Desired Experience: SnowPro Certification (Data Engineer, Administrator, or Architect). title: BI Data Engineer – MS Dynamics 365 F&O

description:
Data Engineer - FinTech Company - Newcastle

(Tech Stack: Data Engineer, Databricks, Python, Azure, Power BI, AWS QuickSight, AWS, TSQL, ETL, Agile Methodologies)

I’m working with a leading Software House in the FinTech industry, based in Newcastle, who are looking to hire a talented Data Engineer. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking company where you’ll play a key role in developing and optimising their data platform.

The Role:

As a Data Engineer, you’ll be working closely with the front office to understand data needs and help shape the company’s data capabilities. You’ll be responsible for building and optimising data pipelines, automating data processes, and ensuring high data quality and governance.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with the front office to scope and understand data requirements.
• Build and maintain the data platform using in-house and third-party tools.
• Automate data processes to improve efficiency and scalability.
• Develop robust data pipelines to ingest and transform data from multiple providers.
• Curate both external and internal datasets to meet business needs.
• Design and implement best-practice data architecture and governance strategies.
• Establish and maintain data quality standards and validation rules.

What They’re Looking For:
• Experience in a data-focused role, with a strong passion for working with data and delivering value to stakeholders.
• Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, and Apache Spark, with hands-on experience using these technologies in a production environment.
• Experience with Databricks and Microsoft Azure is highly desirable.
• Financial Services experience is a plus but not essential.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts in a clear and concise manner.
• Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of tasks while maintaining high standards.
• Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on creating scalable, high-quality solutions.
• Detail-oriented, with a keen eye for spotting data inconsistencies.
• A genuine interest in understanding and solving business challenges through data.
• A 2:1 or higher degree in Computer Science or a related field, ideally from a top-tier university.

Why Join?

This is a great opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a thriving FinTech environment. You’ll be part of a talented and collaborative team, with plenty of opportunities for growth and career development.

If you’re a Data Engineer looking for your next challenge, I’d love to hear from you!

Location: Newcastle, UK

Salary: Competitive + Bonus + Pension + Benefits

Applicants must be based in the UK and have the right to work in the UK even though remote work is available.

To apply for this position please send your CV to Matt Jones at Noir.

Data Engineering in a public cloud environment including cost optimisation.

- that allows our clients to accurately target their adverts to relevant households.

the perks.

Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place The magic of Sky Glass at an exclusive rate A generous pension package Private healthcare Discounted mobile and broadband A wide range of Sky VIP rewards and experiences Inclusion & how you'll work Recognised by The Times and Stonewall, we take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion.

title: Lead Data Engineer > Joboolo UK

description:
Education : EQUIVALENTEXPERIENCE

At Elanco (NYSE: ELAN) – it all starts with animals!

As a global leader in animal health, we are dedicated to innovation and delivering products and services to prevent and treat disease in farm animals and pets. We’re driven by our vision of ‘Food and Companionship Enriching Life’ and our approach to sustainability – the Elanco Healthy Purpose™ – to advance the health of animals, people, the planet and our enterprise.

At Elanco, we pride ourselves on fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We believe that diversity is the driving force behind innovation, creativity, and overall business success. Here, you’ll be part of a company that values and champions new ways of thinking, work with dynamic individuals, and acquire new skills and experiences that will propel your career to new heights.

Making animals’ lives better makes life better – join our team today!

Location: Hook, UK (Hybrid)

Data Engineering at Elanco is growing across ingestion, integration, transformation, consumption, and governance capabilities to deliver data products that will transform how the organization leverages data. The Data Engineering and Platforms organization is seeking an experienced Data Governance Engineer to provide technical leadership to both internal and partner teams working within our Enterprise Data environment. This is a broad role which will include coaching and leading junior engineers in their domain, as well as partnering with engineering and product leadership to deliver on the data strategy.

To be successful in an engineering role at Elanco requires a highly motivated individual with an innovative mindset and willingness to drive tangible outcomes. The individual must be able to articulate complex technical topics, collaborate with internal and external partners, and ensure quality delivery of the required data products.

Reporting to the Associate Director - Data Platforms, the Lead Data Governance Engineer will manage all technical aspects of the Collibra Data Intelligence Platform ecosystem, including platform administration, release management, security, system integrations, and optimization of core components (Console, DIC, Edge, Lineage Harvester, and DQ&O). This role requires expertise in cloud computing, data management, and platform automation, with specific knowledge of Databricks, MS Azure, Terraform, and API integration. As part of a global, cross-functional team of technology and data experts, this role collaborates globally to ensure the platform's successful implementation and adoption.

Responsibilities

Platform Administration
• Administer and maintain the Collibra Data Governance platform including Collibra Console, Collibra DIC, Edge, Lineage Harvester and Collibra Data quality & observability.
• Working in terminals with Shell commands to manage the platform and VMs.
• Work with data engineers to facilitate data integration to systems such as Databricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI, & GCP Big query.
• Configure and manage Collibra communities/domain, workflows, data lineage, and business glossaries.
• Work with business SMEs and identified project partners to develop requirements (functional/non-functional/operational/data quality) for Data Governance, Metadata, Data Quality and translate them into technical solutions.
• Collaborate with data stewards, data owners, and IT teams to ensure data governance policies and standards are effectively implemented.
• Manage licenses and users including role-based access control.
• Responsible for user/ user group onboarding on Collibra with correct privileges, including advising on right privileges to manage security and license cost optimization.
• Develop training materials, use case and asset model documentation, as well as implementation specification.
• Provide recommendations for leveraging full functionality of Collibra platform (workflow, lineage diagrams, UI, dashboards, views, etc.).
• Manage server configurations, monitor system performance, and troubleshoot issues.
• Work closely with Data governance product owner, the Enterprise data office, IT, and data engineering teams to understand requirements, gather feedback, and continuously improve platform performance and user experience.

DevOps and Automation
• Integrate Collibra with other enterprise systems, infrastructure automation, and tools using APIs, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Ansible for CI/CD and IaC.

Continuous Learning
• Provide technical support and training to users on the Collibra platform and related tools.
• Stay ahead of Collibra updates, big data technologies, automation tools, and cloud services.
• Recommend and implement best practices for data governance, automation, and platform management.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent professional experience.
• 4+ years of experience engineering and delivering enterprise scale data solutions, with examples in the cloud (especially Databricks, Azure, and GCP) strongly preferred.
• 4+ years of experience administering a Data governance platform, ideally Collibra.

Additional Skills/Preferences
• Collibra Ranger or Solution Architect certification.
• Ability to translate complex business needs into technical requirements.
• Experience with Infrastructure automation and application techniques and technologies such as Terraform, Kubernetes, and Ansible.
• Strong proficiency in administration, configuration, functional & technical architecture of Collibra across Collibra Data intelligence Cloud, Lineage Harvester, Collibra Edge and Collibra Data Quality & Observability.
• Experience with ETL tools and processes, ensuring proper data lineage and data quality.
• Experience with APIs for system integration and process automation.
• Experience with Collibra Data Quality tools for data profiling and data quality rule implementation.
• Familiarity with data tools and cloud platforms such as Power BI, Azure, Databricks, GCP, and Big Query.
• Experience configuring and customizing workflows in Collibra using Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN).
• Solid understanding of data governance principles, lineage, and metadata management.
• Exceptional problem-solving, proactiveness, and attention to detail.
• Strong communication, collaboration, and the ability to work effectively across teams.
• Experience working in complex enterprise landscapes (business, technology, regulatory, partners, providers, geographies, etc.).

Other Information: Occasional travel may be required.

Direct Reports: 0

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status
title: Lead Data Governance Engineer

description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who will use innovative GCP technology and Cloud Spanner at scale to develop a unified identification service that connects millions of Virgin Media and O2 customers together.

This is a varied role where you will collaborate with highly skilled Architects, DevOps and Analytic Engineering teams to achieve key results for our stakeholders as well as playing an instrumental role in identifying areas for improvement, proposing innovative ideas, and contributing to the overall growth and success of our data team.

Who we are

The UK’s fastest broadband network. The nation’s best-loved mobile brand. And, one of the UK's biggest companies too.

Diverse, high performing teams - jam packed with serious talent. Together, we offer the UK more choice and better value, through our boundary-pushing, customer-championing values and ambitions.

Together, we are Virgin Media O2, and we can't wait to see what you can do.

Accessible, inclusive and equitable for all

Virgin Media O2 is an equal opportunities employer and we're working hard to remove bias and barriers for our people and candidates. So, we build equity and inclusion into everything we do, from the policies we craft to the relationships we shape. We support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey with us.

The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;
• Have strong SQL skills including analytic functions and ensuring data quality.
• Demonstrable production experience working on a cloud environment, preferably GCP.
• Have experience of using a data warehouse engine such as BigQuery or Redshift .
• Have strong proficiency in Python with proven Data Engineering experience.

The other stuff we are looking for

We'd also love you to bring;
• An understanding of DevOps best practices including IaC and CI/CD
• Hands on experience of Apache Beam on Cloud Dataflow

What's in it for you

Our goal is to celebrate our people, their lives and everything in-between. We aim to create a culture that empowers everyone to bring the best versions of themselves to work each and every day. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a brighter world.

Working at Virgin Media O2, you get a bumper reward package bursting with benefits, and loads of extras you can add if you’d like to. These are designed to support both you and your loved ones, making sure that you’re covered no matter what life throws your way.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you as a person and your experience to date. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a take home technical exercise and two stage interview.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.

Please note: Applications will be reviewed, and interviews conducted throughout the duration of this advert, therefore we may bring the closing date forward. We encourage all interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. Thanks for your patience and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

title: Data Engineer

description:
Join Barclays as an R&D Software and Data Engineer where you'll spearhead the evolution of our digital landscape, driving innovation and excellence. In this role, you will be an integral part of our Cyber Fraud Fusion Centre, delivering scalable CFFC services to disrupt and prevent upstream economic crime.

To be successful as an R&D Software and Data Engineer, you will need the following: ​
• Experience working within Financial Service teams responsible for cyber fraud, financial crime or security (web/app).
• Experience with industry fraud and security signals, including any such as digital identity, device, voice, biometrics, and behavioural profiling technologies.
• Knowledge of malicious attack vectors used by cyber fraud adversaries to target the financial sector including but not limited to Device Spoofing, Location Manipulation, Identity Fraud, Account Takeover and False documentation.
• Hands on practical experience using AWS, Python, Relational databases (Postgres, MS SQL, Oracle, Mysql, etc.), SAS PROC SQL, Hue Database Assistant, Teradata, and non-rational Hadoop.

Some other highly valued skills may include: ​
• Knowledge of Enterprise security frameworks such as NIST Cybersecurity Framework and Cyber-attack phases (e.g. Cyber Kill Chain and/or Mitre Att&ck Framework).
• Previous advanced experience using analytical tools and platforms such as SQL/SAS/Hue/Hive Basic, Quantexa, Elastic Search, SAS and MI tools like Tableau and Power BI.
• Advanced knowledge of malicious attack vectors used by cyber fraud adversaries.
• Knowledge of security network architectures (e.g. Proxies, VPN, DNS, web and mail servers) and the principles of network security.
• ICA Certificate/Diploma in Financial Crime Prevention, CAMS Certification, CFE Certification, or equivalent.​

You may be assessed on the key critical skills relevant for success in role, such as risk and controls, change and transformation, business acumen strategic thinking and digital and technology, as well as job-specific technical skills.

The successful candidate can either be based in Knutsford or Northampton.

Purpose of the role

To design, develop and improve software, utilising various engineering methodologies, that provides business, platform, and technology capabilities for our customers and colleagues.

Accountabilities
• Development and delivery of high-quality software solutions by using industry aligned programming languages, frameworks, and tools. Ensuring that code is scalable, maintainable, and optimized for performance.
• Cross-functional collaboration with product managers, designers, and other engineers to define software requirements, devise solution strategies, and ensure seamless integration and alignment with business objectives.
• Collaboration with peers, participate in code reviews, and promote a culture of code quality and knowledge sharing.
• Stay informed of industry technology trends and innovations and actively contribute to the organization’s technology communities to foster a culture of technical excellence and growth.
• Adherence to secure coding practices to mitigate vulnerabilities, protect sensitive data, and ensure secure software solutions.
• Implementation of effective unit testing practices to ensure proper code design, readability, and reliability.

Analyst Expectations
• Will have an impact on the work of related teams within the area.
• Partner with other functions and business areas.
• Take responsibility for end results of a team’s operational processing and activities.
• Escalate breaches of policies/procedure appropriately.
• Take responsibility for embedding new policies/ procedures adopted due to risk mitigation.
• Advise and influence decision making within own area of expertise.
• Take ownership for managing risk and strengthening controls in relation to the work you own or contribute to. Deliver your work and areas of responsibility in line with relevant rules, regulation and codes of conduct.
• Maintain and continually build an understanding of how own sub-function integrates with function, alongside knowledge of the organisations products, services and processes within the function.
• Demonstrate understanding of how areas coordinate and contribute to the achievement of the objectives of the organisation sub-function.
• Make evaluative judgements based on the analysis of factual information, paying attention to detail.
• Resolve problems by identifying and selecting solutions through the application of acquired technical experience and will be guided by precedents.
• Guide and persuade team members and communicate complex / sensitive information.
• Act as contact point for stakeholders outside of the immediate function, while building a network of contacts outside team and external to the organisation.

All colleagues will be expected to demonstrate the Barclays Values of Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship – our moral compass, helping us do what we believe is right. They will also be expected to demonstrate the Barclays Mindset – to Empower, Challenge and Drive – the operating manual for how we behave.

description: Role: Lead Data Engineer (Hands-on) Rate: £425.00 - £470.00 Inside Ir35 Clearance: SC Cleared (actice, used within last 12 months) Location: Hybrid/London (once every month) Start date: ASAP Company Overview: Recruiting for a leading cloud solutions provider specialising in digital transformation and data engineering services.
